item.title: Rosemont Ave being used as a rubbish dump, 25th September
item.description:
Once again, thoughtless people are leaving their rubbish on our pavements. They do not even try to hide their identities: the shopping trolley contains, in addition to other rubbish, mail addressed to a business at 304 Ballards Lane. Will our council please take action to stop fly tippers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Rosemont Avenue, North Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lubbock Road, Elmstead, London

item.title: Dangerous junction for children, 25th September
item.description:
This junction is not safe for children walking to and back from school because of drivers and cyclists who do not stop at the traffic lights. Would it be possble to have a lollipop lady to help in the mornings and afternoons?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole of Boevey path, 25th September
item.description:
As per photos taken after the top half of path was cleaned also the bottom half leading back down to Osborne Rd (ending at house no 39)was just totally missed again. We have made attempts to clear but fox & dogs fouling & piles of leaves is now an issue. The 1 bin for animal waste is at other end of path quite a distance so many don’t pick up. It feels flea ridden as soon as you step out. The adjacent club have been asked many times to clear overshadowing trees to prevent fly tipping & nightly drug hang out but they refuse.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin needs weekly collection, 25th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
